immutableLaws.title: Fundamental Law
immutableLaws.content: All knowledge entries are validated in binary terms (true or false) only, eliminating ambiguity.

immutableLaws.title: Recognition Mechanism
immutableLaws.content: Knowledge is validated and stored through a decentralized recognition mechanism (e.g., consensus or an oracle) which confirms the truth of information before it is added to the ledger.

immutableLaws.title: Growth Rule
immutableLaws.content: The ledger grows by appending new verified knowledge blocks in a linear, tamper-proof sequence, preventing any modification to prior entries.

immutableLaws.title: Self-Replication Rule
immutableLaws.content: Every node holds a full copy of the knowledge ledger, making it self-replicating across the network. Once recorded, knowledge is immutable (cannot be altered) yet accessible and distributable to all participants.

immutableLaws.title: Validation Principle
immutableLaws.content: When knowledge is verified as true and added to the ledger, the contributor is rewarded with newly minted KBC tokens, incentivizing truthful contributions and validations.
